content: Hey, given simple graphs x y z with x ≤ y and disjoint x z, I'd like to get x ≤ y \ z. I've searched through the different order-related lemmas but haven't found anything close to it, not even x ≤ x \ z. Am I searching wrong?
docs#le_sdiff_iff isn't what you want but you should be able to generalize docs#set.subset_diff to generalized_boolean_algebra
Thanks, so it really is just a missing lemma
